steps.content: In the year 2022, and before December, what does "R" stand for in the three core policies of the type of content that was violated in the public logs on the Legume Wikipedia page?

plan: Search for the Legume Wikipedia page to find the public logs and any related content policies.
Identify the three core policies mentioned in the context of content violations on the Legume Wikipedia page.
Determine what "R" stands for in the context of these three core policies, specifically before December 2022.

Legume Wikipedia page public logs content policies

serp.title: Wikipedia:Core content policies
serp.content: Wikipedia's content is governed by three principal core content policies: neutral point of view, verifiability, and no original research.

serp.title: Wikipedia:Content policies and guidelines in a nutshell
serp.content: This is an information page. It is not an encyclopedic article, nor one of Wikipedia's policies or guidelines; rather, its purpose is to explain certain aspects ...

serp.title: Wikipedia:Policies and guidelines
serp.content: This page in a nutshell: Wikipedia's policies and guidelines are pages that serve to document the good practices accepted in the Wikipedia community.

serp.title: Wikimedia Foundation Terms of Use
serp.content: These Terms of Use tell you about our public services at the Wikimedia Foundation, our relationship to you as a user, and the rights and responsibilities ...

serp.title: Wikipedia:Protection policy
serp.content: This policy states in detail the protection types and procedures for page protection and unprotection and when each protection should and should not be applied.

steps.fact_description: three core policies of Wikipedia content
steps.quote_with_fact: Wikipedia's content is governed by three principal core content policies: neutral point of view, verifiability, and no original research.

reasoning: The three core policies of Wikipedia are identified as 'neutral point of view', 'verifiability', and 'no original research'.
The letter 'R' likely corresponds to one of these policies.
Since 'R' is not explicitly in any of the policy names, it may refer to 'research' in 'no original research'.

steps.overview: Identified the meaning of 'R' in the context of Wikipedia's core content policies.
